previous: The above can also be expressed in terms of trigonometric functions:

The principal square root function is thus defined using the nonpositive real axis as a branch cut. The principal square root function is holomorphic everywhere except on the set of non-positive real numbers (on strictly negative reals it isn't even continuous). The above Taylor series for â1 + x remains valid for complex numbers x with |x| < 1.
